speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: SCENE III. The French camp near Dover.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Enter KENT and a Gentleman

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Why the King of France is so suddenly gone back

speaker: KENT
text_entry: know you the reason?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Something he left imperfect in the

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: state, which since his coming forth is thought

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: of; which imports to the kingdom so much

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: fear and danger, that his personal return was

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: most required and necessary.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who hath he left behind him general?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The Marshal of France, Monsieur La Far.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Did your letters pierce the queen to any

speaker: KENT
text_entry: demonstration of grief?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Ay, sir; she took them, read them in my presence;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And now and then an ample tear trill'd down

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Her delicate cheek: it seem'd she was a queen

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Over her passion; who, most rebel-like,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Sought to be king o'er her.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: O, then it moved her.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Not to a rage: patience and sorrow strove

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Who should express her goodliest. You have seen

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Sunshine and rain at once: her smiles and tears

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Were like a better way: those happy smilets,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: That play'd on her ripe lip, seem'd not to know

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: What guests were in her eyes; which parted thence,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: As pearls from diamonds dropp'd. In brief,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Sorrow would be a rarity most beloved,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: If all could so become it.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Made she no verbal question?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: 'Faith, once or twice she heaved the name of 'father'

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Pantingly forth, as if it press'd her heart:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Cried 'Sisters! sisters! Shame of ladies! sisters!

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Kent! father! sisters! What, i' the storm? i' the night?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Let pity not be believed!' There she shook

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The holy water from her heavenly eyes,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And clamour moisten'd: then away she started

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: To deal with grief alone.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: It is the stars,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The stars above us, govern our conditions;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Else one self mate and mate could not beget

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Such different issues. You spoke not with her since?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: No.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Was this before the king return'd?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: No, since.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Well, sir, the poor distressed Lear's i' the town;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who sometime, in his better tune, remembers

speaker: KENT
text_entry: What we are come about, and by no means

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Will yield to see his daughter.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Why, good sir?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: A sovereign shame so elbows him: his own unkindness,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That stripp'd her from his benediction, turn'd her

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To foreign casualties, gave her dear rights

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To his dog-hearted daughters, these things sting

speaker: KENT
text_entry: His mind so venomously, that burning shame

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Detains him from Cordelia.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Alack, poor gentleman!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Of Albany's and Cornwall's powers you heard not?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis so, they are afoot.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Well, sir, I'll bring you to our master Lear,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And leave you to attend him: some dear cause

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Will in concealment wrap me up awhile;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: When I am known aright, you shall not grieve

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Lending me this acquaintance. I pray you, go

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Along with me.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Exeunt
